properties.name: Show Contents
properties.desc: Shows or Hides the Viewer Contents

properties.name: Azimuth And Inclination
properties.desc: The Azimuth And Inclination control allows the user to set the orientation of the View

properties.name: Set To Top View
properties.desc: Zooms to fit the entire model, and displays it centered from top down.

properties.name: Zoom To Fit
properties.desc: Zooms to fit the entire model, and re-centers around the centroid of the scene.

properties.name: Bookmarked Views
properties.desc: Saved views which can be reused.

properties.name: Bookmarked States
properties.desc: Saved states which can be reused.

properties.name: Picked Object
properties.desc: The Picked Object displays the current object selected in the Viewer.  This object can be be updated by holding the Ctrl button and clicking on an object in the Viewer.

properties.name: Picked Coordinate
properties.desc: The Picked Coordinate displays the coordinates of the current object selected in the Viewer.  This object can be be updated by holding the Ctrl button and clicking on an object in the Viewer.

properties.name: Center On Picked
properties.desc: If an object has been picked in the Viewer, the Center On Picked button will force the Viewer to center around that object.

properties.name: Show Viewer Center
properties.desc: Shows an indicator of the current view center point

properties.name: Perspective Mode
properties.desc: Perspective is an important feature, which is off by default. Normally we use a non-perspective view, which displays parallel lines as parallel. Objects are the same size regardless of their distance from the viewer. Perspective gives a view that can be likened to a camera view through a wide-angle lens. It sometimes seems more realistic, but perhaps less scientific (quantitative). The perspective option is used in conjunction with the Field of View. Generally, objects will appear the same size (but distorted) with a 45 degree perspective view and the default view. A smaller Field of View is like zooming in on the display and reduces perspective effects. You can compensate for changing Field of View by adjusting the Viewport Size, changing the Scale, zooming in/out, or translating the objects.

properties.name: Field Of View
properties.desc: The Field of View is used in to compensate for distortion while in Perspective Mode.

properties.name: Renderer
properties.desc: The Renderer control provides the option for either OpenGL or Software rendering. The OpenGL renderer is a high performance renderer which is native to the Windows operating system, and is the default option. For most objects, OpenGL rendering provides much faster rendering performance than the software renderer. However, the Software renderer provides some functionality that the OpenGL renderer does not, and therefore is the desired option for some operations. Specifically, spheres are calculated in the software renderer much more quickly and efficiently then OpenGL which renders a many faceted object. If you are visualizing a large number of spheres you should choose the software rendering option. The other important difference is that the Software Renderer support Depth Sorting when your view has multiple transparent objects.

properties.name: Auto Fit Scene
properties.desc: The Auto Fit Scene control tells the Viewer what kind of change will cause the Viewer to Normalize.

properties.name: Window Sizing
properties.desc: The method for determining how to size the Viewer contents.

properties.name: Viewer Width
properties.desc: The width of the rendered portion of the Viewer, in pixels.

properties.name: Viewer Height
properties.desc: The height of the rendered portion of the Viewer, in pixels.

properties.name: Viewer Actual Width
properties.desc: The actual width of the rendered portion of the Viewer, in pixels.

properties.name: Viewer Actual Height
properties.desc: The actual height of the rendered portion of the Viewer, in pixels.

properties.name: Video Safe Area
properties.desc: The Video Safe Area control is used when creating an animation for DVD or Video. It displays the areas that are usable for both text and animation purposes for several standard video formats. This allows you to properly setup your animation in order to get the best possible output on multiple television sets.

properties.name: View Scale
properties.desc: The Scale to apply to both the viewers height and width when creating the image.  Values are truncated to integers when setting the actual width and height.

properties.name: Auto Scale Forward Facing Font
properties.desc: When the AutoScale Forward Facing Font toggle is selected all Forward Facing fonts in the image will be scaled depending upon the size of the output image.

properties.name: Anti Aliasing
properties.desc: The Anti Aliasing toggle when selected will apply a 4x4 anti-aliasing method to the output image.  This will double the rendered size of the image and then filter and subset to image to the correct width and height.  This process reduces the brightness of fine lines but it also smooths the lines and dramatically reduces jaggies.

properties.name: Anti Aliasing Weight Factor
properties.desc: The Anti Aliasing Weight Factor is used when Anti Aliasing the image.  When Anti Aliasing occurs the image is originally rendered at twice its destination size.  Each pixels color value is then interpolated by using the values of the 16 pixels that form a box around it.  The weighting factor makes the four pixels immediately surrounding the pixel a greater weight when determing the final color.  A higher weighting factor reduces the affect of anti-aliasing.

properties.name: Mask Background
properties.desc: The Mask Background toggle allows you to create an image with a transparent background. Please read the help for the Viewer module for the conditions needed for this feature.

properties.name: Mask Color
properties.desc: The color to mask in the output image.

properties.name: JPEG Quality
properties.desc: The JPEG Quality value affects the (*.jpg) output files. Higher qualities result in less LOSS to the image but create much larger files.

properties.name: Image Filename
properties.desc: The image format to use when creating the image.

properties.name: Measure Distance
properties.desc: Turning on the Measure Distance tool will allow the user to probe two locations in the viewer and return detailed information both about each point as well as information about the line that would connect to the two locations.

properties.name: First Point Location
properties.desc: The first point probed to using CTRL + Left click. This value may be altered to change the line values, but it will make the data and object probed on invalid.

properties.name: Second Point Location
properties.desc: The second point probed to using CTRL + Left click. This value may be altered to change the line values, but it will make the data and object probed on invalid.

properties.name: Clear Points
properties.desc: The Clear Points button will clear the probed points.

properties.name: Distance Line Color
properties.desc: The Distance Line Color refers tot he color of the line between the probed locations.

properties.name: Point Radius
properties.desc: The Point Radius refers to the radius of the spheres displayed at the probe location.

properties.name: Line Filename
properties.desc: The EVS Line File name to process for display.

properties.name: File Behaviour
properties.desc: When an EVS Line File has been selected, the user is given the choice of either overwiting it with the stored points, or to append the points to an existing line file.

properties.name: Style
properties.desc: The Style controls the how to color the Background.

properties.name: Use Unlocked Background
properties.desc: If outputting the Viewer to a 4DIM file or VRML file the background should be set to Unlocked.

properties.name: Primary Color
properties.desc: The Primary Color sets the background color.

properties.name: Secondary Color
properties.desc: The Secondary Color sets the second color of the two color gradient.

properties.name: Depth Sort
properties.desc: When there are two or more transparent objects in your view, without depth sorting the appearance of which object is in front or behind can be improperly displayed.  Properly displaying multiple transparent objects requires sorting the object's order of display based on their apparent position relative to the observer.  There are two different depth sorting options, each requires progressively more computation and is therefore increasingly slower than normal rendering. These options are not available in OpenGL since none of the graphics card manufacturers support this level of sophistication.

properties.name: Update Automatically
properties.desc: User changes to the Viewer will happen be handled immediately when the Update Automatically toggle is on.

properties.name: Refresh
properties.desc: If Update Automatically is not toggled on, the Refresh button will cause the Viewer to handle all user changes.

properties.name: Turn On Ambient Light
properties.desc: The Turn On Ambient Light toggle will toggle the visibility of the ambient light.  Ambient light affects all objects and is not directional.

properties.name: Ambient Light Color
properties.desc: The Ambient Light Color can be set with this control.

properties.name: Show Lights
properties.desc: If the Show Lights toggle is set to on, the position of the lights will be shown in model space.

properties.name: Mouse Controls
properties.desc: The Mouse Controls tell the viewer what object to transform when the mouse moves inside the Viewer.

properties.name: Reset Lights
properties.desc: The Reset Lights button will force all of the lights to return to their default values.

properties.name: Light 1
properties.desc: The control for this light can change its type, color, visibility, etc...

properties.name: Light 2
properties.desc: The control for this light can change its type, color, visibility, etc...

properties.name: Light 3
properties.desc: The control for this light can change its type, color, visibility, etc...

properties.name: Light 4
properties.desc: The control for this light can change its type, color, visibility, etc...

properties.name: Normalization Scale
properties.desc: The camera by default is set a distance away from all objects. The Normalization Scale reduces this distance by a set factor, making the objects appear to be closer.

properties.name: Normalize Invisible Objects
properties.desc: The NormalizeInvisibleObjects toggle tells the Viewer whether to include objects, that have had their Visible status set to off, when adjusting its scale.

properties.name: Global Scale
properties.desc: When Perspective Mode is on a smaller Field of View is like zooming in on the display and reduces perspective effects. You can compensate for changing Field of View by adjusting the Global Scale.

properties.name: Viewport Size
properties.desc: When Perspective Mode is on a smaller Field of View is like zooming in on the display and reduces perspective effects. You can compensate for changing Field of View by adjusting the Viewport Size.

properties.name: Tripod From
properties.desc: The Tripod From coordinates allow the user to set the position the camera looks from.

properties.name: Tripod Up
properties.desc: The Tripod Up coordinates allow the user to set the position that describes the direction defined as 'up' for the camera.  This can produce a roll-like effect.

properties.name: Tripod At
properties.desc: The Tripod At coordinates allow the user to set the position the camera is looking at.

properties.name: Clipping Planes Active
properties.desc: If Clipping Planes are toggled on, objects that are too close or far from the camera will be clipped off.

properties.name: Clipping Plane Front Perspective
properties.desc: If Perspective Mode is on the Clipping Plane Front Perspective sets the position of the clipping plane.

properties.name: Clipping Plane Front
properties.desc: The Clipping Plane Front is the clipping plane closest to the camera, any objects in front of this plane will be clipped.

properties.name: Clipping Plane Back
properties.desc: The Clipping Plane Back is the clipping plane furthest from the camera, any objects in back of this plane will be clipped.

properties.name: Depth Cueing Active
properties.desc: Depth Cueing is an advanced display option, which controls the fading of the light based on the distance objects are from the viewer.

properties.name: Depth Cueing Front
properties.desc: Depth Cueing is a linear blend from the Depth Cueing Front to the Back.  The Depth Cueing Front sets the position, relative to the camera, that lights are at 100 percent.

properties.name: Depth Cueing Back
properties.desc: Depth Cueing is a linear blend from the Depth Cueing Front to the Back.  The Depth Cueing Back sets the position, relative to the camera, that lights are at 0 percent.

properties.name: Depth Cueing Scale
properties.desc: The Depth Cueing Scale amplifies the change between the Front and Back.

properties.name: State Generation Mode
properties.desc: If the State Generation Mode is set to Manual a state will be added to the 4DIM every time the Record Single State button is pressed.  If the Automatic mode is selected, every time the Viewer changes a state will be written to the file.

properties.name: Record Single State
properties.desc: Record a Single State from the Viewer to the 4DIM.  The View state (i.e. Azimuth, Inclination, etc.) is saved at this time as well.

properties.name: Include In Preview
properties.desc: Include this state in the preview images for the 4dm file.

properties.name: Create Temporary 4DIM
properties.desc: The Create Temporary 4DIM toggle allows the user to create a temporary 4d file to view the animation in progress.  This 4d file will not have the ability to track view changes.

properties.name: Delete Last State
properties.desc: Delete the Last State from the 4DIM.

properties.name: Clear All States
properties.desc: Delete all states from the 4DIM.

properties.name: Finish 4D
properties.desc: The Finish 4D button will finish the creation of the 4DIM.

properties.name: Total States
properties.desc: The Total States is a display of the total number of states recorded so far.

properties.name: Total Previews
properties.desc: The Total Previews is a display of the total number of preview images captured so far.

properties.name: Author
properties.desc: The Author field allows the user to set the author name on the output 4DIM.

properties.name: Organization
properties.desc: The Organization field allows the user to set the organization name on the output 4DIM.

properties.name: Track By Default
properties.desc: Set this 4DM output to track view changes by default when opened.

properties.name: Notes
properties.desc: The Notes field allows the user to set any notes for the output 4DIM.

properties.name: VRML Filename
properties.desc: The output VRML file name.  Setting this filename will cause the file to be written.

properties.name: Output Optimization
properties.desc: The Output Optimization sets the type of output to optimize the VRML for.
